ruleset.name: Code Style
ruleset.description: Rules which enforce a specific coding style.

rule.name: AtLeastOneConstructor
rule.message: Each class should declare at least one constructor
rule.description: Each non-static class should declare at least one constructor. Classes with solely static members are ignored, refer to [UseUtilityClassRule](pmd_rules_java_design.html#useutilityclass) to detect those.

rule.name: AvoidDollarSigns
rule.message: Avoid using dollar signs in variable/method/class/interface names
rule.description: Avoid using dollar signs in variable/method/class/interface names.
rule.example: public class Fo$o { // not a recommended name }

rule.name: UseShortArrayInitializer
rule.message: Array initialization can be written shorter
rule.description:
When declaring and initializing array fields or variables, it is not necessary to explicitly create a new array using `new`. Instead one can simply define the initial content of the array as a expression in curly braces.
E.g. `int[] x = new int[] { 1, 2, 3 };` can be written as `int[] x = { 1, 2, 3 };`.
rule.example: Foo[] x = new Foo[] { ... }; // Overly verbose Foo[] x = { ... }; //Equivalent to above line
